intro: Schmidelia paniculata, commonly known as the clustered schmidelia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, often with a slight pubescence. Schmidelia paniculata is typically found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
